alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 9:08PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Crawford County through 930 PM CDT... At 907 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Denison, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail and additional heavy rainfall of one to two inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Crawford County, including the following locations... Denison Municipal Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Iowa.
